PART-I
PRELIMINARY
l. Short title, extent and commencement.- (l) This Act may be
called the Protection of Joumalists and Media Professionals Act, 2021.
(2) It shall extend to the whole of Pakistan
(3) It shall come into force at once.
2. Definitions.- (l) In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in
the subject or context,-
(a) "Act" shall mean the Protection of Journalists and Media

(b) "Authority" means the Authority established under the Legal Aid

Pakistan;

0) "Journalist" means any person who is professionally or regularly

(k) "Media professional" includes any other person regularly or

communications;

PART-II
RIGIITS OF JOURNALISTS AND MEDIA PROFESSIONALS
3. Right to life and protection against ill treatment.- (1) The
Govemment shall ensure that every joumalist and media professionals right to
life and security of person. as contained in Article 9 of the Constitution, is
safeguarded, and that no such individual is subjected to illtreatment.
(2) No person or institution, whether private or public, shall engage in
any act that violates the right to life and security of any journalist or media
professional.
(3) In order to maintain the independence, impartiality and freedom of
journalists and media professionals, the Govemment shall take steps to ensure
that existing or future counter- terrorism or national security laws are not utilized
arbitrarity to hinder the work and safety ofjoumalists and media professionals.
inctuding through arbitrary arrest or detention, or the threat thereof.
(4) The Government shall ensure that effective measures are taken to
protect joumalists and media professionals against forced or involuntary
disappearances, kidnapping, abduction or other methods ofcoercion.
(5) The Government shall ensure that joumalists and media
professionals are allowed to carry out their journalistic work in conflict-affected
areas within the country, without threats, intimidation, harassment or fear of
persecution or targeting.
(6) If the Commission finds that any institution or organization is.
directly or indirectly, involved in violating. or attempting to violate. the rights to
life and protection against ill treatment safeguarded in sub-section (l) above, it
shall report the same to the Federal Govcmment and recommend appropriate
course ofaction against the perpetrator(s) ofthese violations.
4. Right to privacy and non-disclosure of sources.- (l) Each
joumalist and media professional shall have the right to privacy, which includes
PART I] THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., DECEMBER 4.202t 859
protection of the law against interference with his/her home, correspondence,
and family.
(2) The Govemment shall ensure that no person, officer, agency or
institution unlawfully or arbitrarily interferes with the right to privacy of anyjoumalist, reporter or media professional and his/her home, correspondence
(including electronic correspondences) and family.
(3) The Government shall ensure that no joumalist, reporter or media
professional is forced, induced, compelled, coerced or threatened for the
disclosure of his/her sources of information by any person, officer, agency,
authority or institution save without due process ofthe law.
(4) The Govemment shall make efforts to safeguard the confidentiality
of sources, ofjournalists or media professionals.
5. Independence in the performance of duties.- (l) No joumalist
or media professional shall be subjected to any unlawful or arbitrary restrictions
on their ability to perform their work independenrly, and without undue
interference.
(2) Any restriction on the right ro freedom of expression ofjoumalists
or media professionals must be in accordance with the existing laws, and must
only be imposed if it is necessary for respect of the rights or reputations of
others, or if such restriction is levied against material that advocates natibnal,
racial or religious hatred that constitutes incitement to discrimination, hostility or
violence.
(3) Any restriction imposed under Section 5(2) ofthis Act must:
(D be easily accessible to the public;
(ii) comply with the principles of legality, necessity and
proportionality: and
(iii) be formulated with sufficient precision to enable a joumalist,
reporter or media professional to adjust his or her conduct
accordingly.
6. Good faith obligation ofjournalists and media professionals. - ( I ) All journalists and media professionals must respect the rights or reputationsof others and not produce material that advocates national. racial, ethnic,
religious, sectarian, Iinguistic, cultural or gcnder-based hatred, rvhich may
constitute incitement to discrimination, hostility or violence.
(2) All journalists and media professionals must not engage in rhe
dissemination of material knou,rr by such an individual to be false or untrue.

(2) will be tried in accordance with the relevant laws.
7. Protection from abusive, violent and intolerant behaviour.-(l) The Govemrnent shall take all steps to protect journalists and media
professionals from all fonns of abuse, violence and exploitation through anv
medium (including electronic communications) at the hands of any person,
institution (private or public) or authoriq..
(2) Whenever any act of abuse, violence or intolerant behaviour is
committed against any journalist, reponer or media professional, whether ^
perpetrated by a private or public person, institution or authority. the aggrieved
joumalist or media professional shall file a complaint tyilhin a period of fourteen
(14) days, against the same before the Commission created under section I2 of
the Act.
(3) Upon receipt of information identified in Section 7(2) of this Act,
the Commission shall, within a period of fourteen (14) days, take all necessary
actions to investigate and prosecute such acts of abuse, violence or intolerant
behaviour, and to take appropriate measures under Iaw to provide protection to
the concemed journalist, reporter or media prolessional in the manner prescribed
under this Act.
8. Protection against harassment.-{ l) The Govemment shall
ensure that every journalist, reporter and media professional is protected against
harassment, as defined in Section 2(h) of this Act.
(2) Whencver any act of harassment is commined against any
journalist or media professional, whether perpetrated by a private or public
person, institution or authority, the aggrieved person may tile a complaint
against the same before the Federal Ombudsman u,ithin a period of fourteen ( I4)
days.
(3) Upon receipt of information identified in Section 8(2) of this Act,
the Federal Ombudsman or the relevanl authority shall, within a period of
fourteen days, take all necessary actions to investigate and prosecute such acts of
harassment, and to rake appropriate measures under the law to provide protection
to the concerned journalist, reporter or media professional.
